dialogues.text: Jacques!

dialogues.speaker: BUTLER
dialogues.text: on staircase; from Gaston's point of view. He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, M'sieu Laval?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame has changed her mind. She'll  be down in a minute.  He goes into office, shuts door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still one beat behind) Very well, m'sieu!  Followed by camera, he continues down stairs, punch-drunk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in office. Gaston has just closed door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I told you I don't want to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you have an engagement, and I  don't want people to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk? About me--about us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironically) Afraid I'm ruining your reputation,  M'sieu Laval?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No--yours, madame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a slight pause) M'sieu Laval, I've got a confession  to make to you ...  Gaston, remembering that Lily once used the same phrase  before she him a crook, turns with a flash of alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like me. In fact, you're crazy  about me. Otherwise, you wouldn't  worry about my reputation. Isn't  that so?  Gaston looks at her with relief and delight. She is as  charming as if she herself were a crook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But incidentally, let me tell you,  I don't like you. I don't like you  at all!  (Going close to him.) I wouldn't hesitate one instant to  ruin your reputation--like that!  (She snaps her fingers.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loving the game;  stepping closer) You would?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (even closer) Yes, I would!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping his fingers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping her fingers again) Like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playing tough) I know all your tricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (also tough) And you're going to fall for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you think you can get me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any minute I want!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're conceited--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But attractive--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, let me tell you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up--kiss me!  (Gaston embraces and  kisses her. She kisses  him ardently, then frees  herself for a moment,  holds him off.)  Wasting all this marvelous time  with arguments!  (Kisses him again. He  takes her in his arms.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It rings several times. No one answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is ringing--a different tone from the one we have just heard. Butler enters and answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello ... Well, I'll try him again.  (He pushes a button.)  Yes, he's in his office, but he's  busy ... Madame Colet? She's still  here--yes ... But she's busy, too  ... Well, I'll ring again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: office door. Telephone still ringing inside. Nobody seems to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily at phone, putting down receiver. She sits, very  thoughtful. She tries to hum the fandango she had been  humming so gaily before. Now it comes in fragments as she moves about, sits, gets up. She is worried and suspicious

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hall clock is striking eight. Butler comes up stairs, goe to office door, and knocks. To his multiple confusion,  behind him Mariette's door opens and Gaston appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Jacques?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Gaston's new location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M'sieu Giron is downstairs.  GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with vast authority) Tell M'sieu Giron I can't see him  now. Impossible!  (Butler is about to leave.)  And, Jacques. Dismiss the car! Madame  is not going.  (He turns back into  Mariette's room,  shuts door.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (by now a confirmed cynic) Yes, M'sieu Laval!  Followed by camera, shaking his head, he goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It opens. Mariette appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacques!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking dizzily in  wrong direction) Yes, madame--  (Turning.)  Yes, madame!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't dismiss the car! I'll be down  in a few minutes.  (She shuts door. )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds his jittery way down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariette and Gaston at foot of bed. Bed is untouched. On  bed is her wrap. Mariette picks up wrap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (passionately) I want you to stay, Mariette.  You've got to stay. You can't go  now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm crazy about you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding him off) I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why do you want to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I want to make it tough for  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston takes her in his arms, kisses her passionately. Sh returns kiss with even greater passion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still in his arms;  genuine feeling in  its full wisdom) We have a long time ahead ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The couple are seen at one angle, as dialogue continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weeks ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another angle on the couple as she says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: months ...

dialogues.speaker: THE EMPTY BED
dialogues.text: Their embracing shadows lie the length of the bed, giving the effect of two bodies in a sex embrace on the bed, as  she says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: years! ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of that, Gaston--the future  lies bright before us! A real struggle goes on in Gaston. She kisses him tenderl frees herself, and, followed by camera, goes to door, sto turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless; in a very  low voice, making the  rendezvous for later) Eleven o'clock!  (She is gone; door closes.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man in love, completely shaken. He sits on bed, thinks, then takes telephone slowly, decisively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Г‰lysГ©e seven, eight, seven, nine.

dialogues.speaker: LILY'S HOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: The luggage is packed and in order. Followed by camera, L dressed for travel, paces nervously up and down. Phone ri She rushes to phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello ... Darling! Oh, darling,  it's good to hear your voice! I  thought you'd never call! I tried to  get you ... What? What?  (Camera moves to  big close-up of her.)  Tomorrow morning? Why?  (Tears come into her eyes.)  Of course ... Um-hum ... Um-hum ...  (With a brave,  cheerful tone.)  That sounds reasonable--very  reasonable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEQUENCE I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Mariette. It is after dinner. We hear voices and music Her thoughts are with Gaston. She sips from a champagne  glass. Medium close-up to include her chair and a small  table. She puts glass on the table and, oblivious to othe guests, leans back dreamily, anticipating a night of love eyes closed. Camera pans to a couch not too near Mariette. FranГ§ois a the major, smoking cigars.  Camera moves to close-up. The are watching Mariette. They exchange a look of understand They have become friends, realizing that neither has a  chance with Mariette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAJOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intimately) No doubt about it--it's that  secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, the kind of men women fall  for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No color, no sparkle--but  dependable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANГ‡OIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The type they marry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I'm not the marrying type.  I like to take my fun and leave it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANГ‡OIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inspecting the  major; friendly) Nice suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smart. London, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ogilvie and Oglethorpe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought so. Both men lean back. A moment of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patronizingly) He's really not a bad fellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just dull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANГ‡OIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insignificant ... He's a secretary,  always was a secretary, always will  be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAJOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) Funny--the first time I saw him I  thought he was a doctor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting up suddenly) Doc--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FranГ§ois looks stricken. Major, worried, thinks FranГ§oi a heart attack. FranГ§ois gets up; Major gets up. FranГ§o stares into space, then unseeingly at Major. Major become alarmed. FranГ§ois sits. Major sits with him. With sudden decision, FranГ§ois snaps his fingers, stands up. Major a stands up. FranГ§ois, followed by camera, goes straight t Mariette. Major, in a daze, follows. Mariette is still  dreaming. FranГ§ois taps her on the shoulder. She looks u His expression frightens her. FranГ§ois, waving his hand, tries to talk. The words don't come. Finally one escapes  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANГ‡OIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonsils!  (Major and Mariette think  the man has gone insane.)  Positively tonsils!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from outside. Behind the glass, Gaston's hand drumming on the pane nervously. Camera pulls back, and we see Gaston  looking into the night, waiting restlessly. Suddenly he  turns around sharply toward the door. Apparently someone  has knocked at the office door. Camera swings over to the next window, and we recognize the office, which adjoins  Gaston's bedroom. Through office window we see butler, wh has knocked on bedroom door, waiting. Bedroom door opens, and Gaston emerges It is apparent that butler delivers a  message. Camera moves down one floor and stops in a close shot of living room window from outside. Behind the glass stands Giron. He also drums nervously on the pane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at door to the corridor. Door opens. Gaston enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns. Gaston comes into picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently) I'm very sorry, but this is no time,  M'sieu Giron--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emphatically) I've got to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now! It's very important,  M'sieu Laval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may be important to you, M'sieu  Giron--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, to you--M'sieu Monescu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause, as they face each other.  GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cordially) Won't you sit down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In entrance driveway stands Mariette's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of entrance door. Mariette comes out, followed by Major a FranГ§ois. All are excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Mariette, please... Now  listen--it's true ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Followed by camera, they approach car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's absolutely ridiculous! I don't  believe it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Mariette--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm awfully tired anyhow. So please  leave me alone. Good night!  (She steps into car.  Chauffeur shuts car door  and goes out of picture  to driver's seat. FranГ§ois  and Major linger awkwardly.  Door opens and Mariette  leans out.)  I had a very lovely time!  (Door doses.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting toward the car from opposite side. View of house and Major and FranГ§ois is covered by car. Car pulls away see Major and FranГ§ois moving toward house, chummy,  animatedly talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANГ‡OIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I said to myself, "All right, if  he wants to look at them, let him  look at them. No harm in that." And  then he said, "Say ah!" And that's  all I remember ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They disappear into house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston and Giron at door to hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking he is the winner) So ... You will pack your things at  once!  GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with deceptive humility) Yes, m'sieu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you will be out by tomorrow  morning.  GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well, m'sieu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otherwise I'll call the police

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, m'sieu.  (Giron is about to leave.)  M'sieu Giron!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening a new subject) You have enjoyed the confidence of  this family for more than forty  years. You must be a man of about-- about sixty-five.  (Giron looks puzzled  and uneasy.)  Let's see--  (Gaston counts on  his fingers.)  You will be exactly eighty-seven  when you come out of prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (outraged) What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say I am a crook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amiably curious) Then why didn't you call the police?  Why don't you call the police?  (Conversationally.)  I'll tell you why--you crook, you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trembling with indignation) M'sieu ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helpfully) Monescu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M'sieu Monescu!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) Just call me Gaston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it drives along. Close shot of Mariette. She knows tha FranГ§ois told the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to Mariette's house. It opens, and Giron emerges, full of dignity and indignation. Gaston, in the doorway, is a  smiling host.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after him) Good night, Adolph!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giron stops in his tracks as Gaston shuts door.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWAY
dialogues.text: Gaston hastens up. He reaches landing and is about to ent his office, when outer doorbell rings. Exasperated, he  hastens down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at entrance door. Gaston opens. There stands Giron, furio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you dare to call me Adolph!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston slams door in Giron's face and turns back.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWAY
dialogues.text: Gaston starts up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UPPER LANDING is about to enter office, thinks a moment,  then goes toward Mariette's bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dark. Door opens. Gaston enters, shuts door, turns wall switch, flooding room with light. He moves to a nigh table by the bed, on which is a small lamp, turns on the  lamp, then goes back to wall switch and turns off main  lights. Room is now in soft shadow, with only the small  light. He turns to window, sees that shade is not down, g toward the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of same window from outside. Gaston appears, is just abou to pull down shade when he glances toward his own bedroom other wing of house. He sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to other wing of house and stops outside Gaston's bedroom window. Behind window stands Lily looking across at him. situation is clear; she knows the worst. She looks  menacingly calm.

dialogues.speaker: MARIETTE'S BEDROOM WINDOW
dialogues.text: from outside. Gaston is in trouble and he knows it. He go quickly toward door.

dialogues.speaker: GASTON'S BEDROOM WINDOW
dialogues.text: from outside. Lily, having seen Gaston leave Mariette's r pauses, makes up her mind, then draws the curtains closed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at door. It opens. Gaston rushes in, looks toward window, doesn't see Lily, turns, and sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at the wall safe. She has one hand on the dial and is fac Gaston defiantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Followed by camera, he goes to Lily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you insane? You've to get out  of here at once! She may come back  any minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimly) What time is your rendezvous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic) Now, Lily--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, M'sieu Colet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staggered; recovering;  desperate) You have to get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitterly) That's what I'm here for--to get  out! I want to get away from here,  from you--as fast as I can and as  far as a hundred thousand francs  will take me.  (She returns to the  safe, hand on dial.)  Sixty-five, ninety-four--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you realize--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-five to the left--sixty- three, eight ... I wouldn't fall for  another man if he were the biggest  crook on earth ... Seventy-six,  eighty-four, fifty-five--  (Suddenly facing  him; bitterly.)  What has she got that I haven't got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily, you must listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Don't make up any stories!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Lily--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you dare lie to me!  (Ironically.)  I know you love me.  (Pause. He is helpless.) Well, why don't you say something?  Come on--be brilliant. Talk yourself  out of it--bluff yourself in!  (Gaston makes an  effort to speak.)   Shut up, you liar, you! (She turns back to safe,  opens it, looks inside.)  That's what I want!  (Taking out the stacks  of bank notes.)  This is real! Money! Cash!

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: in front of Mariette's house. Her car comes, stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston's door. Lily comes out, very excited, closing door behind her. Followed by camera, she runs down steps, acro hall, toward entrance door. Doorbell rings. She stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butler in a chair, half-asleep. Bell rings again. He gets and goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at entrance door. Lily has disappeared. Butler comes, ope door. Mariette enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUTLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, madame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweeping past him, followed by camera, Mariette goes up  stairs. She pauses at her bedroom door. Changing her mind she goes to Gaston's door. She knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from hall. Gaston opens the door. He sees Mariette, smile and opens her door very wide, welcoming her to her own ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at Gaston's door to his office-and-bedroom suite. She smi at him enigmatically. Instead of responding, she opens hi door and goes in, leaving door open. As she goes she give him another smile, as if to say, "This is where it's goin to be."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: puzzled, but not worried. He closes her door and goes tow his own door.

dialogues.speaker: GASTON'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Mariette stands in the center of the room. Gaston enters, closes door, goes toward her. Camera moves to close shot both. She embraces him--they kiss. Then, languorously, sh takes off her wrap. He helps her. She drops wrap on bed.  Then she reaches for her necklace with the seductive air a woman about to disrobe. She takes off the necklace, the jeweled pin on her bosom, then her bracelets and rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he watches her;  a lover, but careful) When a lady takes her jewels off in  a gentleman's room, where does she  put them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gallantly) On the night table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (provocatively) But I don't want to be a lady.  She kisses him lightly and moves out of the picture, the  jewels in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariette enters with the intention of opening the safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is startled. He goes quickly toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariette is about to turn the dial. Gaston enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helpfully) May I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (again with that  smile; playful) Ah, let me have a little fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playing the game; graciously) Please!    (He moves away.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston enters, sits on the arm of the chair, and leans ba smiling, on guard. MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beginning to dial) Now let me see--sixty-five, ninety-four--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-three--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No--thirty-five!  (She laughs.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs, too. They are apparently having a jolly time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues to dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-five ...  (Very casually.)  You know, FranГ§ois--M'sieu Filiba-- thinks you're a very remarkable man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For one swift instant his face tells us that now he knows the worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was at the dinner tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing to dial) Sixty-three, eight--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariette!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns toward him charmingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with pretended innocence) Yes, Gaston?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you say if you found  your safe had been robbed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't say anything--I would  act. GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if to say,  "It's a good idea") Um-hum ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lightly) But why talk about robbery on a  night like this?  She pauses--is it ironically? He is not quite sure. He  takes a last chance.  GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ardently) You look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  (Turning back  coolly to safe.)  Seventy-six, eighty--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising; the game  is over) Mariette!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Gaston?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have been robbed--for years. And  not a hundred thousand francs, but  millions. And you know who did it?  Adolph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adolph?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adolph J. Giron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing at him) And you expect me to believe that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naturally not. But I expect the  police to believe it.  (He goes out to  night table.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston enters, picks up telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at the safe. Frightened, she goes quickly to telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariette enters, takes receiver out of Gaston's hand, set it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? He's a thief--he's a  criminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you afraid to let me  prove it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariette turns away. She is beginning to suspect there mi be truth in what he says.  GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironically) It would be a terrible scandal,  wouldn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself) Giron...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Giron! Chairman of the board of  Colet and Company. Honorary  president of the Orphans' Asylum.  Adolph J. Giron--distinguished  citizen! ... Well, shall I call the  police?  (Mariette's silence  eloquently says no.)  I see! You have to be in the social  register to keep out of jail. But  when a man starts at the bottom and  works his way up--a self-made crook --then you say, "Call the police!  Put him behind bars! Lock him up!"  (He glares at her  indignantly, then  goes to the safe.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston enters, gives the dial one turn, and safe opens. T papers inside are in complete disorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: staring at the open safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston enters, bows formally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't seem to have my calling  cards with me, Madame Colet. So  permit me to introduce myself  informally--Gaston Monescu. I  assure you in my own circles I am  very well known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariette looks at him sadly for a moment. She gets up,  restraining tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted a hundred thousand  francs, and I thought you wanted  me. Gaston is deeply moved. Mariette turns, moves sadly towar window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtains are now open. We see the church steeple--the sam one we saw romantically before. Mariette enters and leans her head against the window, her back to the camera. The  church clock strikes eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is crushed. Followed by camera, he goes to her, stops her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came here to rob you--but  unfortunately I fell in love with  you.  (No reaction.)  Mariette!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitterly) Why did you take the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston is speechless; the truth is too complicated.  Despairing, she goes. He stands looking after her. We hea her steps as she crosses the room; then we hear the door  shut. He turns to the window. Suddenly he stares toward  Mariette's bedroom window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariette's bedroom window from outside. Behind the window is Lily, looking across at him implacably. She has witnes the scene at the opened safe and has come to her own  conclusions.

dialogues.speaker: GASTON'S BEDROOM WINDOW
dialogues.text: from outside. Close-up of Gaston. He looks at Lily,  dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at door to corridor, from inside. Mariette enters. Sudden she turns, and she too is dumbfounded, because she sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from Mariette's viewpoint. Lily is still looking out at  Gaston, her back to Mariette. She hears the door close,  turns, sees Mariette, takes in the situation at a glance, and goes, proudly direct, toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily enters. They face each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame, the only thing that seems  to stand between you and romance is  a hundred thousand francs. Well, he  didn't take it.  (She brings the bank  notes out of her jacket.)  I took it--all by myself. Now you  can have your romance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scornfully) I think you'd better go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever had a romance with a crook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me give you a little advice.  When you embrace him, be sure to put  on your gloves. It would be too bad  if your fingerprints were found ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle Gautier--or whatever  your name is--I thank you for your  advice, but I must ask you to go.  You've got your money--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (violently) I don't want your money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Gaston appears. He stops inside the door. Both women t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Gaston,  but talking to Mariette) You wanted to buy him for fifty  francs. Well, you can have him for  nothing!  (She tosses the money  out of picture.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money falls on bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily walks toward Gaston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LILY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleadingly)  Lily--  (He takes her arm.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freeing herself) Leave me alone! You were willing to  sacrifice a hundred thousand francs  for her.  (She turns to Mariette,  sizes her up.)  Well--  (she has a sudden idea)  she's worth it!  [(To Mariette.)  You were willing to pay a hundred  and twenty-five thousand for a  handbag. You can pay a hundred  thousand for him!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily enters, takes the money she had gallantly relinquish

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing like two guilty schoolchildren. Lily comes into  picture, walks past them to door, opens door, turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye--Madame Colet and Company!  (She leaves, slamming door.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls) Lily!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dashes to door, goes out, closes door. Behind the door hear their excited voices. Mariette goes a step closer to door. She is in a state confused suspense. Suddenly the  voices cease. We hear, muffled, a woman's footsteps runni down the stairs. Then, following, a man's footsteps. Then silence. Now, Mariette, followed by camera, goes to the b and sinks into it heartbroken: she will never see Gaston  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside we hear the slowly returning footsteps of Gaston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sitting up on bed. She turns toward door with hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston enters, closes door, and moves toward Mariette. He looks very grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sitting on bed. Gaston goes to her. Pause.  GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with great feeling) Goodbye... MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up; also  with feeling) Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could have been marvelous ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divine ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful ... But tomorrow morning,  if you should wake out of your  dreams and hear a knock, and the  door opens, and there, instead of a  maid with a breakfast tray, stands  a policeman with a warrant--then  you'll be glad you're alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) But it could have been glorious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divine ... But that terrible  policeman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye ...  (He takes her in his  arms. They kiss. He  goes to door.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston opens door, turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what you're missing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuts her eyes and dreamily nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) No ...  (Out of his coat pocket  he takes the necklace  of seed pearls.)  That's what you're missing! ...  Your gift to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For an instant she is taken aback; then she smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (graciously) With the compliments of Colet and  Company!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bows, goes. Door shuts behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks after the departed Gaston a moment. Her mood is broken by ringing of telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello ... Yes ... What? ... Yes ...  No, no. Thank you very much, but  the handbag has been found  (sadly and with  another meaning)  exactly two weeks and three days  ago.  (She hangs up.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close shot of Gaston and Lily. There is a strained silenc between them. Gaston smiles toward her. He is trying to  make up, but she sits frozen. He smiles again, anticipati the surprise he has in store for her. He reaches for the  pearls in his pocket. A look of dismay crosses his face-- the pearls are not there! He looks in all his pockets, ca find them. Suddenly, with suspicion, he looks sidelong at Lily. She responds to his look with a triumphant smile. F her bosom she brings forth the string of pearls and holds up. He is amazed, can't figure it out. She reaches behind brings forth a handbag, which we recognize as the one  originally stolen from Mariette, and she drops the pearls into the bag. Gaston is now smiling with admiration, yet looks sly. As Lily drops in the pearls she glances into t bag. Her expression changes. Something is missing. She lo suspiciously toward Gaston. Nonchalantly, he draws, from inside breast pocket, the precious bank notes, and slips too into the bag. They smile at each other. Together fore they embrace and kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE END

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screenplay by Samson Raphaelson

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble in Paradise Most any place can seem to be a paradise While you embrace just the one that you adore There needn't be an apple tree with magic powers You need no garden filled with flowers To taste the thrill of sweet greed hours Gentle perfume and cushions that are silk and soft Two in the gloom that is silent but for sighs That's paradise while arms entwine and lips are kissing But if there's something missing  That signifies  Trouble in paradise Colet and Compagnie Colet, Colet, Colet and Compagnie  Are makers of the best perfume. If you and your beloved can't agree,  Permit us to suggest perfume. Cleopatra was a lovely tantalizer.  But she did it with her little atomizer. We'll make you smell like a rose;  Every nose in Paris knows Colet and Compagnie.
